table_caption: Random forest importance parameters mean minimal depth, number of nodes, accuracy decrease, Gini decrease, number of trees, times a root, and p-value), and the direction of significance for the top significant variables (p < 0.05) are shown. Two of the impulsivity scores (motor and non-planning) and 12 rsFC connections were identified as important features to classify individuals into either AUD or CTL group. The variables are sorted based on the p-values.
